tips.title: Activate patrol camera or recording device.
tips.detail: While traveling to scene and while on scene.

tips.detail: Interview reporting party and assess case details

tips.title: Notify supervisor.
tips.detail: Follow agency policies and procedures

tips.title: Conduct preliminary investigation
tips.detail: Interview Caller(s), Suspect(s) or Wtinesses, Collect statements, Record Contact information, Details, Photograph(s), Clothing Description, Mental/Physical Disabilites, etc.

tips.title: Is there evidence of an abduction?
tips.detail: If evidence of an abduction exists contact NYSP COMSEC (1-518-457-6811) to request an
tips.circ: ayc ac dd aut abd unk med oft veh

tips.title: Verify custody situation and domestic violence history.
tips.detail: Verify most recent court order, and check for protection orders or domestic violence history. Contact court if necessary to verify.

tips.title: Is online enticement or other online activity involved?
tips.detail: Arrange to have computer examined by forensic expert.

tips.title: Obtain Vehicle information.
tips.detail: Registration Number, Year, Make, Model, Color, How much fuel is in the car, is it On-Star equipped, unique identifiers (stickers, paint colors, dents/body damage, accessories, etc)
tips.circ: veh

tips.title: Make DCJS Portal/NCIC entry
tips.detail: Entry made with the correct condition and circumstance.

tips.detail: Entry made with correct condition

tips.title: Issue B.O.L.O. to area agencies.
tips.detail: Information sent to law enforcement agencies in the surrounding areas.

tips.title: Secure place last seen.
tips.detail: Secure potential evidence and K-9 scent items
tips.circ: all

tips.title: Conduct Case assement.
tips.detail: Determine urgency and risk factors. Utilize search urgency charts.
tips.circ: all

tips.title: Collect personal history information .
tips.detail: Likes or dislikes, favorite places, friends, relationships, etc
tips.circ: all

tips.title: Where did the person previously live or work?
tips.detail: Have addresses checked by law enforcement.

tips.title: Is there a prior history of missing incidents?
tips.detail: Check with reporting party as well as in-house records management system.
tips.circ: ayc ac aa alz dd ds aut abd run unk lwa med

tips.title: Do they display any identifiable behavior?
tips.detail: Flappnig hands, repetitive movements, are they non-verbal, etc
tips.circ: ayc ac aa alz dd aut abd run unk lwa med oft

tips.title: Is subject a Project Lifesaver client?
tips.detail: If yes, collect transmitter information.
tips.circ: ayc ac aa alz dd ds aut abd run unk lwa med oft

tips.title: Does the missing wear identification?
tips.detail: ID tags, bracelets, Project Life Saver, GPS device, temporary tattoos, etc
tips.circ: all

tips.title: Does the missing have a particular interest?
tips.detail: Water, trains, music, places, etc
tips.circ: all

tips.title: What water sources are nearby?
tips.detail: Especially for autisitic children who are often fascinated by water
tips.circ: ayc ac aa alz dd ds aut run unk lwa med oft

tips.title: What medications are they prescribed?
tips.detail: Last time they were taken, do they have medication with them, what is the dosage, etc

tips.title: Does person own a firearm?
tips.detail: Is it accounted for?

tips.title: What is the child's safety zone?
tips.detail: Usually determined by the child's age and parents/guardians set boundaries.
tips.circ: ayc ac dd aut abd run unk lwa med oft

tips.title: Develop a timeline.
tips.detail: From time of last contact through duration of investigation.
tips.circ: all

tips.title: Identify area hazards.
tips.detail: Highways, construction sites, natural hazards, water sources, attractive nuisances, garbage routes, etc.
tips.circ: ayc ac aa alz dd ds aut run unk lwa med oft

tips.title: Check the weather forecast.
tips.detail: Severe weather may influence search urgency.
tips.circ: all

tips.title: Conduct a hasty search.
tips.detail: Quick methodical search of surrounding area of point last seen.
tips.circ: all

tips.title: Search person's room
tips.detail: Determine if personal items are missing.  Secure potential evidence in accordance with your agency’s procedures.  Secure items, such as bedding or clothing, to be used as scent articles for search dogs.  Secure letters, cards, diaries, address/phone books, photographs, items with potential fingerprints, DNA (hairbrush, toothbrush, pillow case).
tips.circ: all

tips.title: Search .25 mile radius around point last seen.
tips.detail: Look for signs of travel or evidence.
tips.circ: ayc ac aa alz dd ds aut abd run unk lwa med oft

tips.title: Look for decision points and signs of travel.
tips.detail: Purchase of transportation tickets, trailhead log books, surveillance cameras, witnesses
tips.circ: all

tips.title: Conduct a neighborhood canvas.
tips.detail: Door to door search for witnessess and information in the area of point last seen. Interview and document (name, address, phone number(s), email, etc)  all residents and guests. If no response indicate for follow up.
tips.circ: all

tips.title: Restrict escape routes.
tips.detail: Containment with road patrols, license plate readers, road blocks, etc…
tips.circ: all

tips.title: Identify registered sex offenders in the area.
tips.detail: Locate and Interview. (Sex Offender Registry)
tips.circ: ayc ac dd aut abd run unk lwa med oft

tips.title: Identify surveillance cameras in the area.
tips.detail: Both private and publically owned. Are they accesible 24/7
tips.circ: all

tips.title: Establish a command post.
tips.detail: Institute ICS protocols. Location should not be at the residence.
tips.circ: ayc ac aa alz dd ds aut abd unk lwa med oft veh

tips.title: Assign a family liason.
tips.detail: Point of contact for family, gather further critical information, provide support services.
tips.circ: ayc ac aa alz dd ds aut abd unk lwa med

tips.title: Request additional resources.
tips.detail: Aviation, K-9, Search and rescue, Forest Rangers, etc

tips.detail: Ensure adequate staffing levels, utilize lead tip form or leads management software, advise surrounding agencies of incident, dedicated phone line, etc.

tips.title: Activate A Child is Missing.
tips.detail: Free rapid-response, high-tech telephone alert system. 1-888-875-2246
tips.circ: ayc ac aa alz dd aut abd unk lwa med oft

tips.title: Request assistance from Team Adam
tips.detail: Active/Retired law enforcement who will assist with missing child investigation. Request assistnace through National Center for Missing and Exploited Children (1-800-THE- LOST)
tips.circ: ayc ac dd aut abd unk med oft

tips.title: Request and organize search teams.
tips.detail: Availability of equipment, personnel, team leaders, communications, food/water, restrooms/portable toilets,
tips.circ: ayc ac aa alz dd ds aut abd unk lwa med oft

tips.title: Establish a search perimeter.
tips.detail: Consider medical conditions, physical conditions, timeline, access to transportation, weather conditions, etc.

tips.title: Monitor social media activity.
tips.detail: Facebook, Twitter, MySpace, Instagram, Whisper, SnapChat, etc.

tips.title: Utilize data tracking.
tips.detail: Cell phone ping/gps locate, credit/debit card activity, on-star, etc

tips.title: Repeat search of residence/nursing home twice a day.
tips.detail: Missing may return to residence on their own.

tips.title: Is it time to suspend the search?
tips.detail: Consider current effectivness of search, any clues or leads generated, timeframe since missing report, weather conditions, available resources, budget concerns, etc

tips.detail: Identify strengths and weaknesess , potential policy changes, future planning, etc
